Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2010 02:58AM Linqing wrote:  I have been taking Tykerb since mid-January.  The first two months were pretty hard, though not as bad as what you describe.  But I was pretty miserable, including high bilirubin counts, liver pain, wickedly bad gerd, lots of stomach cramping, and the runs most of the time.   But then I was able to get my body to adjust to this medicine by doing the following:  hydrate -  lots of water every day;  every few days drink a concoction of 1 cup of warm water, one teaspoon of olive oil and 1 tablespoon of squeezed lemon juice first thing in the morning (helped my liver), and waiting an hour before eating; eating very carefully (no acidic foods; low fat; no red meat; and low sugar).  I also did not take the pills when I felt terrible.  Once had to stop for a week, with my doctor's permission becuse my liver counts were bad.    Suddenly in late March my ability to tolerate this drug changed dramatically.  Now all these  side affects are gone.  And so far the cancer is receding...  HOpe this helps.
